column4: is it possible to access my wubi files from within windows?  Ubuntu isn't starting up after ATI driver installs and I want to back things up first.
assuming you are using ext2 or ext3 filesystem you can install ext2ifs in windows to gain access to your linux partitions from within windows
thank you for the response.  I have been trying to use explore2fs and it cant open the root.disk
im a newb myself, but ext2ifs worked well for me, but it doesnt obey any file permissions nor does it do ext3 journaling by what i read on it.
